DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as determined by the clinician/investigator.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Adverse Event Attribution to Product or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A specific identifiable level (defined qualitatively or quantitatively) of probability of adverse event being caused or associated with the product or procedure administration to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

Property.preferredName: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: A specific identifiable level (defined qualitatively or quantitatively) of probability of adverse event being caused or associated with the product or procedure administration to a patient.

Concepts.definition: A specific identifiable level (defined qualitatively or quantitatively) of probability of adverse event being caused or associated with the product or procedure administration to a patient.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was this adverse event relate
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was this adverse event related to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsored-defined Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the relationship between the AE and the study treatment (e.g. ICH E2B examples include: Not Related, Unlikely Related, Possibly Related, Related). Another possibility is the use of Y and N. CDISC Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. It is recommended that you check with the appropriate regulatory authority for population of this variable so that it meets their expectations for your submission.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AEREL
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate if the cause of the adverse event is related to the study treatment and cannot be reasonably explained by other factors (e.g., subject's clinical state, concomitant therapy, and/or other interventions).

DataElement.changeDescription: Created as part of CDISC mapping task. 6.21.18 mc Performed QC and released per COG request. mc 5.26.2020
